snippet: Disaster-preparedness capitalism may have begun in the cold war. But it grows with every hurricane, as consumers clamor for generators, kerosene heaters, industrial fans and other products.
abstract: Disaster-preparedness industry, which may have begun in the cold war era, is growing fast, driven of late by freakish storms like Hurricane Sandy; consumers are clamoring for generators, kerosene heaters, industrial fans and other products; market is in multiple billions of dollars.
lead_paragraph: Disaster-preparedness capitalism may have begun in the cold war. But it grows with every hurricane, as consumers clamor for generators, kerosene heaters, industrial fans and other products.

headline.seo: Hurricane Sandy and the Disaster-Preparedness Economy
headline.main: Hurricane Sandy and the Disaster-Preparedness Economy
